alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Inland; Clarke; Monroe; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 1:21PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Monroe, north central Baldwin, southern Washington and southeastern Clarke Counties through 200 PM CST... At 120 PM CST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Deer Park, or 8 miles north of Citronelle, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deer Park and McIntosh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama.
